results.title: Cowes Regatta
results.brief_description: Hundreds of craft assemble in the harbour at Cowes, to participate in the world famous regatta. From Cowes the film takes you to the Brittania Cup race, 1965, with the Duke of Edinburgh and Princess Anne competing in the royal yacht, Bloodhound.

results.title: Cowboy Bebop. Vol. 4
results.creator_credit: Shinichiro Watanabe, Kazuhiko Ikeguchi, Masahiko Minami, Bandai Visual Company, Victor Entertainment and Sunrise Inc
results.brief_description: This stylish and action packed Japanese anime television series is set in a 21st century dystopia where the earth is a wasteland and the solar system is besieged by a proliferation of gangsters. A motley group of bounty hunters who occupy a rickety ship, the ‘Bebop’, reluctantly band together. The group consists of Spike Siegel, a vicious fighter whose cynicism covers painful memories; Jet Black, a former policeman; Faye Valentine, a femme fatale and compulsive gambler; and Ed, a computer hacker girl. Session 15 “My funny Valentine” Faye tries to come to terms with the fact that she knows little about her past, prior to being cryogenically frozen. Session 16 “Black dog serenade” A riot on a prison ship unites Jet with an old cohort from his police days. When the criminal is the same one responsible for the loss of his arm, Jet seeks retribution. Session 17 “Mushroom samba” The Bebop is out of fuel, cash and food - consequently Ed takes on a bounty hunter mission, looking for a crooked magic mushroom dealer. Session 18 “Speak like a child” An anonymous package arrives for Faye, which leads to some clues about her mystifying past. “Cowboy Bebop” is an amusing cross-pollination between anime, the Western genre, classic Sci-fi flicks, and neo-noir with an anti-hero narrative overlayed with ultra cool aesthetics.

results.title: Cowboy Bebop. Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Shinichiro Watanabe, Kazuhiko Ikeguchi, Masahiko Minami, Bandai Visual Company, Victor Entertainment and Sunrise Inc
results.brief_description: This stylish and action packed Japanese anime television series is set in a 21st century dystopia - the earth is a wasteland and the solar system is besieged by a proliferation of gangsters. A motley group of bounty hunters, who ride aboard their rickety ship, the ‘Bebop’, reluctantly band together. The group consists of Spike Siegel, a vicious fighter whose cynicism covers painful memories; Jet Black, a former policeman; Faye Valentine, a femme fatale and compulsive gambler; and Ed, a computer hacker girl. Session 11 “Toys in the attic” When Jet is bitten by a mysterious organism, Spike and Ed are forced into the bowels of the Bebop to try to uncover the source and save their workmate. This episode has much in common with “Aliens” with a similar brand of black humour. Session 12 “Jupiter jazz (1)” Faye absconds with the Bebop loot and Jet wishes to retrieve her but Spike is more interested in tracking down Julia, his long-lost love - a quest which draws him into confrontation with arch-nemesis, Vicious. Session 13 “Jupiter jazz (2)” As Jet hunts for Faye and the missing money, Faye tries to uncover the secrets of the elusive Gren, a man/woman seeking vengeance. Session 14 “Bohemian rhapsody” After a series of robberies at the high tech toll booths that control interstellar travel, the Bebop crew are enlisted to track down the perpetrators. “Cowboy Bebop” is an amusing cross-pollination between anime, the Western, classic Sci-fi flicks, and neo-noir with an anti-hero narrative overlayed with ultra cool aesthetics.

results.title: Cowboy and Maria in town
results.creator_credit: Annie Stiven, Les McLaren, Australian Film Commission and Vingan
results.brief_description: Attracted by the myths of town life, and the chance of work, people from villages all over Papua New Guinea have come to the towns. This documentary tells the story of two such migrants living in the settlements that surround the Capital Port Moresby. Cowboy is a reformed ‘rascal’ who plays rock and roll on a homemade guitar in the street earning just enough for his family to get by. Maria lives an equally precarious existence. Seasonal gardening, and her husband’s small income as a night security guard are their means of survival. Cowboy and Maria are vital players in the new urban Papua New Guinea. Their interwoven stories highlight the consequences of urban drift, where traditional and Western values meet.

results.title: Cowboy
results.creator_credit: Gary Schlosser, Michael Ahnemann and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: The day-to-day existence of the working cowboy. It examines the life on a Californian ranch of a contemporary “cowpuncher”, Bill Bailey, and his family. Narrated by themselves, it reveals the hard work and simple pleasures and the profound rewards. Living in the open and close to the land, the cowboy retains the individuality and self-reliance which marked his forbears. Photographed at the Rex Ellsworth Ranch Tehachapi California.

results.title: Cow on the frontier = Krava na granici
results.brief_description: An animated film showing a harmless cow grazing a field, which unwittingly steps across the frontier that separates one country from another. A satire on war.

results.title: Covered Wagon
results.creator_credit: James Cruze and Famous Players-Lasky Corporation
results.brief_description: Recounts the journey by the men and women who left the Mississippi and Ohio valleys in 1848 to migrate to Oregon. Most of this Western epic was shot on location and captures the beauty of America’s vast frontier landscape. Essentially a romantic drama focusing on the leader of a wagon train who falls in love with the daughter of another wagon train leader. Before he can win her heart, he must clear himself of false cattle theft charges. During the journey, the wagon trains are exposed to forces of nature and the wrath of native Americans Indians defending their land against intruders. Script by Jack Cunningham based on the novel by Emerson Hough. Photographed by Karl Brown. Edited by Dorothy Arzner. Starring Alan Hale, J. Warren Kerrigan, Charles Ogle and Lois Wilson. Based on the novel by Emerson Hough.

results.title: Cover to cover looks at ... = a pet for Mrs Arbuckle ...
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, John Marsh, Anna Grieve and Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production
results.brief_description: Three programs from the Cover to cover series which look at three of Australia’s best known children’s books. The authors and illustrators talk about how their books evolved, the techniques they used and other aspects of their work. The three books discussed are: ‘A pet for Mrs. Arbuckle’ by Gwenda Smyth, illustrated by Anne James, ‘Five times dizzy’ by Nadia Wheatley and ‘The Inside hedge story’ by Gillian Barnett.
